item.title: Comment on What is Haitian food like in the United States? by Indoor Camping
item.description:
Now we're sharing Chris Rufo hoaxes? We're doing our best to dispel this nasty stuff that is easily disprovable with absolutely zero reports of this type of activity.

Who comes to an insightful economist website to learn of conspiracy theory-type slandering of our fellow citizens?

item.description:
After the upset post about Vance’s couch-gate, it’s a bit disheartening to see no willingness to address racist slander spread by Trump & Vance. Maybe he doesn’t want to get on the wrong side of Thiel.

item.title: Comment on Civil War by Hazel Meade
item.description:
Tyler's comments are off base but yours are on target. The film is really about journalists and the "thrill" of being close to combat, without actually being a combatant. And also the way that journalism dramatizes conflict for fame and fortune. It's a vivid metaphor that the journalists are quite literally driving us (the audience) into a civil war, because they love that drama and the thrill of it. And because they earn their fortune on it.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/09/civil-war-2.html?commentID=160811739

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/09/civil-war-2.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=civil-war-2

item.title: Comment on Civil War by War experienced
item.description:
"war is hell but it’s also fucking amazing"
I have experienced war.
War is amazing only and only if you are absolute psycho.
If you don't have first hand experience in sex please don't write about fucking.
